alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 6:06PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT/10 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Franklin and Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Calhoun and Gulf. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT /1000 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM CDT /606 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port St. Joe, Mexico Beach, Wewahitchka, Stonemill Creek, Dalkeith, Honeyville, Willis Landing, Milltown, Howard Creek, Highland View, Saint Joe Beach, Ward Ridge, Overstreet, Beacon Hill, Jones Homestead, Chipola Cutoff, Odena, Simmons Bayou and St Joseph State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
